name: Red Fox
description: Red foxes are agile mammals known for their keen hearing and ability to adapt to various environments. Commonly found in forests and grasslands.

name: Blue Jay
description: Blue Jays are intelligent and noisy birds often seen in forests. They are recognized by their bright blue feathers and loud calls.

name: Eastern Chipmunk
description: Small and fast rodents known for storing food in their cheek pouches. Chipmunks are active during daytime in forest areas.

name: Painted Turtle
description: Painted turtles are freshwater reptiles often seen basking on logs near lakes and ponds. Recognized by their colorful shell patterns.

name: Bald Eagle
description: A powerful bird of prey known for its striking white head and tail. Often found near large bodies of water where it hunts fish.

name: Great Blue Heron
description: Tall wading birds found along rivers and wetlands. They stand motionless for long periods while hunting fish.

name: Harbor Seal
description: Marine mammals often seen resting on sandy beaches. Harbor seals are playful and excellent swimmers.

name: Green Frog
description: Green frogs live near wetlands and rivers. Their calls are deep and loud, resembling the sound of a plucked banjo string.

name: Snowshoe Hare
description: Known for its large hind feet that help it move quickly over snow, this hare changes fur color with the seasons.

name: Black Bear
description: Black bears are omnivorous mammals found in mountainous forests. They are excellent climbers and strong swimmers.
